Text: Consultants view on gas transmission into California Cc Rod As we discussed here are the bulletts that summarize what we heard from our consultants Overall demand picture Believe it will be before the California market will get back to demand levels demand down approximately mmcfd demand will be flat growth in demand will begin return to demand levels Reasoning was a dry year the lack of hydro generation created an additional mmcfd demand for gas in California Anticipated generation capacity overbuild in California new more efficient power plants with better heat rates will displace older gas fired generation reducing the amount of gas required to generate a MW of electricity on the margin California electricity rate increases have curtailed demand for power and subsequently gas Gas transmission capacity into the state Over the next two to three years there will be an additional Bcfd of transmission capacity into California mmcfd in mmcfd in Kern River expansion mmcfd El Paso conversion of All American oil line and power up San Juan basin gas San Juan basin production is declining first half of vs first half of production off by approximately mmcfd Rockies gas will not replace declining production in the San Juan San Juan gas will move closer to Permian pricing The consultants believe that the combination of these factors will put decontracting pressure on existing transmission into the state of California and especially the El Paso and Transwestern lines However the wild card in their view is unforeseen California power demand growth As we discussed JPMorgan would like to hear your views on the above issues Please give me a call when you have had sufficient time to digest and we can set up a conference call to make the most efficient use of your time Thanks Rod Brent Also when you have had a chance to look at sales gas volume growth please email the volume numbers to methanks

Transwestern information requests Cc Rod As per our phone conversation the list of information we would like to have follows FERC Form s for the last three years Revenue breakdown Assumptions made for the contracted period as well as the time period beyond current contracts firminterruptible mix and volumes tariffs for each type of transportation contract A build up from contracts to the revenues in the model would be ideal As before compressor gas volumes and assumed sales prices for the projected years As before the story as it relates to CERAs view of the world Explicit calculation of rate base going forward Employee benefit plan information funding status return rates future liabilities Thanks Rod When you have a time in mind for a call to discuss the above list please contact Eric Fornell Home or myself Home Work Cell
Re FW California Proposed ProjectsThanks Rod
Re FW WSCC Power AZNMNVxlsThank you Rod
